title: Why being invested during November and December can double your returns
text:
Despite the gloom of never-ending Brexit talks, investors should continue to back quoted British companies throughout the remainder of the year, new research has shown.

Over the past 30 years the final months of the year have often been the most lucrative for British investors.

Research from Brewin Dolphin, the wealth manager, showed on average over the first 10 months of the year investors have made 0.38pc per month if buying a FTSE 100 tracker of the largest 100 British companies.

Buying a FTSE All Share tracker, which replicates investing in the whole market, would have netted 0.56pc per month.

But in November and December this jumps to 1.32pc for both indices, more than double the return...
